text:
Disney's The Lion King remake UK release date, cast and latest news Disney is remaking one of its biggest animations - The Lion King - here's what we know so far Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Walt Disney Studios confirmed The Lion King will be getting a remake following the success of The Jungle Book. 
The Lion King was originally released in 1994 and is one of the biggest animated films of all time and grossed $968.8 million at the box office. 
It won a raft of awards for its musical score, including Academy Awards for the original song Can You Feel the Love Tonight (Elton John, Tim Rice) and original score (Hans Zimmer), plus two Grammy Awards, with the soundtrack selling over 14 million copies. 
As well as being a hit on broadway it's become a children's television show with James Earl Jones' returning to the role as Mufasa. 
Fans were at first unsure at the news the classic animation would get a remake, raising concerns over whether it can improve on the original. 
There was also the fact The Jungle Book cut the music, whereas The Lion King animation was praised for its score. When will it be released? The Lion King holds a special place in Disney fans hearts Read More 
There is no set date yet, but reports say Disney has fast tracked the project after fans eager reception and The Jungle Book's success. Will it be live action? Simba in The Lion King takes over Pride Rock (Photo: Disney) 
The Jungle Book used CGI to create the jungle animals, with The Lion King set in the African Plains will Disney opt for the same treatment? 
So far they have just called the movie a "re-imagining" though it is highly likely it will follow in the same vein as director Jon Favreau, who was at the helm of the Jungle Book has been taken on. What can we expect? 
The film will be directed by Jon Favreau, the man behind the Jungle Book. 
Disney said in a release: "The Lion King builds on Disneyâ€™s success of reimagining its classics for a contemporary audience with films like Maleficent, Cinderella, and the upcoming Beauty and the Beast ." 
Favreau is a big fan of Virtual Reality though, and is spearheading an interactive VR firm called Gnomes and Goblins. Whether this will impact on The Lion King or just The Jungle Book sequel remains to be seen. Who will star? Will The Lion King be a CGI live-action remake? 
Donald Glover has been cast as Simba, and James Earl Jones will reprise his role as Mufasa. 
Director Jon Favreau made the announcement on Twitter. Is there a trailer yet? 
No trailer yet, but we all live in hope. 
What other remakes are in the works? 
What isn't may be a better question! Mulan is set for 2018, Beauty and the Beast for 2017 with Emma Watson as Belle. 
There's also talk of Peter Pan, 101 Dalmatians, Pinocchio and Dumbo. What is Lion King about? The harrowing moment Mufasa died (Photo: Disney) 
The Disney animation follows the adventures of the young lion Simba, the heir of his father, Mufasa. 
Simba's uncle, Scar, plots to usurp Mufasa's throne by luring father and son into a stampede of wildebeests. 
But Simba escapes, and only Mufasa is killed. Simba returns as an adult to take back his homeland from Scar with the help of his friends Timon and Pumbaa. 
People have pointed out the similar plot to Hamlet. Like us on Facebook
